title.narrative: Key Trends and Drivers of Indian Forestry : Future Scenarios and Challenges

description.narrative: The Indian forestry sector epitomizes the dichotomy between India's desire to emerge as a leading global economic power and its ability to cope with complex social problems. A more comprehensive debate on forest management and regulation is needed to shape pro-poor policy, avoid social conflict and promote rural development. This grant will support the preparation of 10-12 think pieces on trends in the forestry sector in India over the last two decades. The key findings will be synthesized, published as policy papers and presented at public policy events. The lessons from the think pieces will help draft a new narrative on the forestry sector that harmonizes the aspirations of the poor, the integrity of forest ecosystems and the economic growth of rural communities.
